Bed.py - Tools for working with bed files¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Code¶

class Bed.Bed¶

Bases: object

an interval in bed format.

empty constructor.

fromGTF(gff, is_gtf=False, name=None)¶

fill from gtf formatted entry.

columns¶

return number of columns in bed-entry.

class Bed.Track(line)¶

Bases: object

bed track information.

Bed.iterator(infile)¶

iterate over a bed formatted file.

The iterator is track aware.

This iterator yields Bed objects.

Bed.setName(iterator)¶

yield bed entries in which name is set if unset.

Bed.grouped_iterator(iterator)¶

yield bed results grouped by track.

Bed.blocked_iterator(iterator)¶

yield blocked bed results.

Bed.readAndIndex(infile, with_values=False, per_track=False)¶

read and index a bed formatted file in infile.

If with_values is set, the original bed entry will be kept for further reference. Otherwise only the intervals will be indexed and any additional fields in the bed entry will be ignored.

The default is to use all intervals. If per_track is set, separate indices will be build for each track.

Bed.binIntervals(iterator, num_bins=5, method='equal-bases', bin_edges=None)¶

merge adjacent bins by score.

Several merging methods are possible:

equal-bases
merge intervals such that each bin contains the equal number of bases
equal-intervals
merge intervals such that each bin contains the equal number intervals

This options requires the fifth field (score) of the bed input file to be present.

bins should be non-overlapping.

returns a list of intervals (Bed) and the bin_edges

Bed.merge(iterator)¶

merge overlapping intervals.

returns a list of merged intervals.

Bed.getNumColumns(filename)¶

return number of fields in bed-file by looking at the first entry.

Returns 0 if file is empty.
